title: Drawing, "Day Couch for Mrs. Allen's Boudoir, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas", 1917
medium: Graphite, color pencil on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, between two ruled lines, upper margin w/ red sqaure, left: FURNITURE DETAILS . 8 (all underlined); lower right: DAY COUCH FOR MRS. ALLEN'S BOUDOIR . (all underlined); left center: ELEVATIONS OF DAY-COUCH (all underlined); in Wright's hand, upper left: cover in mohair Sating Henry II/Like drawing - with chairs in same material/think soft grey? ends blue?/frame for back faded cushion/with two vertical braces/detailed Nov. 21 '17/OK (all underlined)
creditline: Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition and Friends of Drawings and Prints Funds
description: At center of page, two colored drawings of day couch, one on the right is from the front, one on the left is of the right side. Lower right, colored drawing, there is a graphite drawing of the day couch from above.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Day Couch for Mrs. Allen's Boudoir, Henry J. Allen Residence, Wichita, Kansas", 1917.Graphite, color pencil on cream tracing paper. Museum purchase from Smithsonian Regents Collections Acquisition and Friends of Drawings and Prints Funds. 1983-1-5.
